member.name: T:Jboy.JsonSerializer
member.summary: Represents a serializer method that is called to generate JSON data from a given object instance. This is used to specify callbacks for serializing custom types.
member.param: A writer to which the JSON data should be written.
The object instance which is being serialized.

member.name: T:Jboy.JsonDeserializer
member.summary: Represents a deserializer method that is called to create an object instance from JSON data. This is used to specify callback for deserializing custom types.
member.param: A reader from which the JSON data should be read.
member.returns: An object instance which is the result of the deserialization.

member.name: T:Jboy.Json
member.summary: Provides a static interface for serializing and deserializing whole runtime objects to and from JSON. Provides an API to read and write whole object from JSON data, and to manage the codecs that define how this mapping is done.

member.name: M:Jboy.Json.AddCodec``1(Jboy.JsonDeserializer,Jboy.JsonSerializer)
member.summary: Adds a new codec for serializing and deserializing instances of .
member.typeparam: The type for which the codec should be used.
member.param: A callback that deserializes an instance of .
A callback that serializes an instance of .
member.remarks:
When or is called, will be called by the system to produce JSON text from the given instance. Similarly, when or is called, will be called by the system to read the JSON text and produce an instance of .
If the type already has a codec, it will be overwritten.
Calling this method will register codecs for , [] and .

member.name: M:Jboy.Json.WriteObject(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts to a string containing JSON data.
member.param: The object instance to serialize.
member.returns: A string containing the JSON representation of .
member.remarks:
If no codec has been registered for the type of , this method will throw a .
Each call to this method creates a internally and calls with this writer. If you make many several calls to this method intended for the same JSON target, it is probably more efficient to create your own and call yourself. You can then extract the JSON text from the .

member.name: M:Jboy.Json.WriteObject(System.Object,Jboy.JsonWriter)
member.summary: Writes to as JSON data.
member.param: The object instance to serialize.
The writer to which the JSON data will be written.
member.remarks: If no codec has been registered for the type of , this method will throw a .

member.name: M:Jboy.Json.TryReadObject``1(System.String,``0@)
member.summary: Tries to read an instance of from a string of JSON text.
member.typeparam: The type of the object to read.
member.param: A string containing the JSON text that will be read.
The resulting instance of that was read from the JSON data.
member.returns: True if the read was successful, and false otherwise.
member.remarks:
If no codec has been registered for , this method will return false.
Each call to this method creates a internally and calls with this reader. If you make many several calls to this method using the same JSON source, it is probably more efficient to create your own from the source and call yourself.

member.name: M:Jboy.Json.TryReadObject``1(Jboy.JsonReader,``0@)
member.summary: Tries to read an instance of from a stream.
member.typeparam: The type of the object to read.
member.param: A reader which contains the JSON data to read from.
The resulting instance of that was read from the stream.
member.returns: True if the read was successful, and false otherwise.
member.remarks: If no codec has been registered for , this method will return false.

member.name: M:Jboy.Json.ReadObject``1(System.String)
member.summary: Reads an instance of from a string of JSON text.
member.typeparam: The type of the object to read.
member.param: A string containing the JSON text that will be read.
member.returns: The resulting instance of that was read from the JSON data.
member.remarks:
If no codec has been registered for , this method will throw a .
Each call to this method creates a internally and calls with this reader. If you make many several calls to this method using the same JSON source, it is probably more efficient to create your own from the source and call yourself.

member.name: M:Jboy.Json.ReadObject``1(Jboy.JsonReader)
member.summary: Reads an instance of from a stream.
member.typeparam: The type of the object to read.
member.param: A reader which contains the JSON data to read from.
member.returns: The resulting instance of that was read from the JSON data.
member.remarks: If no codec has been registered for , this method will throw a .

member.name: M:Jboy.Json.Reset
member.summary: Resets the class to its initial state. This will reset all codecs to the default set of codecs.
member.remarks: You normally don't have to call this function, but it can be convenient during testing, and for use in Unity where static state can remain between different runs within the Unity Editor.

member.name: T:Jboy.JsonArray
member.summary: Represents a JSON array node in a JSON data tree.
member.remarks: implements the interface, which makes it possible to interact with it in any way that possible for a .

member.name: T:Jboy.JsonTree
member.summary: Abstract base class for all node types in a JSON data tree. Provides a static API for constructing a runtime tree from JSON text. Also provides basic API for manipulating any JSON data tree or subtree.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonTree.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines if this instance is equal to another object.
member.param: The other object instance to compare to.
member.returns: True if the instances are equal, and false otherwise.
member.remarks: For two instances to be equal, both need to be of the same type and have the same value (if the type has a value). Two instances are equal if they have equal elements in the same order. Two instances are equal if all keys and values are equal, and appear in the same order.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonTree.Equals(Jboy.JsonTree)
member.summary: Determines if two instances of are equal.
member.param: The other instance to compare to.
member.returns: True if the instances are equal, and false otherwise.
member.remarks: For two instances to be equal, both need to be of the same type and have the same value (if the type has a value). Two instances are equal if they have equal elements in the same order. Two instances are equal if all keys and values are equal, and appear in the same order.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonTree.ReadTree(System.String)
member.summary: Reads JSON data from a string and creates a from the data. The tree can then be traversed and manipulated through the methods of the class.
member.param: A string containing the JSON text that will be read.
member.returns: A corresponding to the JSON data.
member.remarks:
If the read fails, due to invalid JSON in the input, a will be thrown.
Each call to this method creates a internally and calls with this reader. If you make many several calls to this method using the same JSON source, it is probably more efficient to create your own from the source and call yourself.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonTree.ReadTree(Jboy.JsonReader)
member.summary: Reads JSON data from a stream and creates a from the data. The tree can then be traversed and manipulated through the methods of the class.
member.param: A reader that contains the JSON data to read from.
member.returns: A corresponding to the JSON data.
member.remarks: If the read fails, due to invalid JSON in the input, a will be thrown.

member.name: P:Jboy.JsonTree.IsObject
member.summary: Indicates whether this node is a JSON object.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to (jsonTree is JsonObject).

member.name: P:Jboy.JsonTree.IsArray
member.summary: Indicates whether this node is a JSON array.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to (jsonTree is JsonArray).

member.name: P:Jboy.JsonTree.IsString
member.summary: Indicates whether this node is a JSON string value.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to (jsonTree is JsonString).

member.name: P:Jboy.JsonTree.IsNumber
member.summary: Indicates whether this node is a JSON number value.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to (jsonTree is JsonNumber).

member.name: P:Jboy.JsonTree.IsBoolean
member.summary: Indicates whether this node is a JSON boolean value.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to (jsonTree is JsonBoolean).

member.name: P:Jboy.JsonTree.IsNull
member.summary: Indicates whether this node is a JSON null value.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to (jsonTree is JsonNull).

member.name: P:Jboy.JsonTree.AsObject
member.summary: Returns this node cast to a JSON object node.
member.remarks:
This is roughly equivalent to ((JsonObject) jsonTree).
If the node is not a JSON object, an will be thrown.

member.name: P:Jboy.JsonTree.AsArray
member.summary: Returns this node cast to a JSON array node.
member.remarks:
This is roughly equivalent to ((JsonArray) jsonTree).
If the node is not a JSON array, an will be thrown.

member.name: P:Jboy.JsonTree.AsString
member.summary: Returns this node cast to a JSON string node.
member.remarks:
This is roughly equivalent to ((JsonString) jsonTree).
If the node is not a JSON string, an will be thrown.

member.name: P:Jboy.JsonTree.AsNumber
member.summary: Returns this node cast to a JSON number node.
member.remarks:
This is roughly equivalent to ((JsonNumber) jsonTree).
If the node is not a JSON number, an will be thrown.

member.name: P:Jboy.JsonTree.AsBoolean
member.summary: Returns this node cast to a JSON boolean node.
member.remarks:
This is roughly equivalent to ((JsonBoolean) jsonTree).
If the node is not a JSON boolean, an will be thrown.

member.name: P:Jboy.JsonTree.AsNull
member.summary: Returns this node cast to a JSON null node.
member.remarks:
This is roughly equivalent to ((JsonNull) jsonTree).
If the node is not a JSON null node, an will be thrown.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonArray.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance. The new array will be empty.

member.summary: Writes the instance, and all of its children, to a JSON text string.
member.returns: A string containing the JSON text representation of the .
member.remarks: Each call to this method creates a internally and calls with this writer. If you make many several calls to this method intended for the same JSON target, it is probably more efficient to create your own and call yourself. You can then extract the JSON text from the .

member.summary: Writes the instance, and all of its children, to a stream.
member.param: The stream that the JSON data should be written to.
member.remarks: If is in a state where a new JSON array can't be started, a will be thrown.

member.name: M:Jboy.JsonArray.ToString
member.summary: Produces a string representation of the instance.
member.returns: A string containing the JSON text of the instance.
member.remarks: For convenience, this method simply returns the result of .

member.summary: Gets the index of a given element in the array.

member.returns: The zero-based index of the element in the array.

member.summary: Determines if two instances of are equal.
member.param: The other instance to compare to.
member.returns: True if the instances are equal, and false otherwise.
member.remarks: For two instances to be equal, both need to have equal elements in the same order.

member.name: T:Jboy.JsonObject
member.summary: Represents a JSON object node in a JSON data tree.
member.remarks:
behaves much like an ordered dictionary, which means that you can access JSON properties both by their name and by their index.
implements the interface, which makes it possible to interact with it in any way that possible for a . A contains a property name and property value.

member.summary: Adds the given property to the end of the .

member.remarks: Each call to this method creates a internally and calls with this writer. If you make many several calls to this method intended for the same JSON target, it is probably more efficient to create your own and call yourself. You can then extract the JSON text from the .

member.remarks: If is in a state where a new JSON object can't be started, a will be thrown.

member.summary: Determines if two instances of are equal.

member.summary: Gets or sets the property value at the given index.

member.returns: The value of the property at .
member.remarks: is essentially an ordered dictionary, so property values can be accessed both by property name or by their zero-based index.

member.returns: The value of the property.
member.remarks: is essentially an ordered dictionary, so property values can be accessed both by property name or by their zero-based index.

member.name: P:Jboy.JsonObject.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of properties of the .

member.name: T:Jboy.JsonObject.JsonProperty
member.summary: Represents a JSON property in a JSON object. A property is a combindation of a string name and a value which can be any JSON value.
member.remarks: This class is only used when enumerating the contents of a . It is not used for internal storage and is not used in when adding or removing properties from an object. For this you use the dictionary-like interface of where the name of the proprty is the key.
